function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The generated code currently lacks a proper database or persistent storage system for storing user, file, and activity data. Currently, it uses Python dictionaries to store this data, which means all data will be lost once the application is stopped. As a suggestion, consider integrating a database system such as SQLite or PostgreSQL to persistently store user and file data. This will also allow for more complex queries and better performance when dealing with large amounts of data.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The generated code currently lacks proper error handling and validation. For example, in the `register` function in `user_management.py`, there is no check to see if a user with the same email already exists. This could lead to data being overwritten unintentionally. As a suggestion, consider adding checks and validation to ensure data integrity. Also, proper error messages should be returned to the client to make the API more user-friendly.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The generated code currently lacks a proper authentication and authorization system. For example, any user can update any other user's profile or download any file without needing to provide any form of authentication. As a suggestion, consider implementing a token-based authentication system such as JWT (JSON Web Tokens) to secure the API endpoints. This will ensure that only authenticated and authorized users can perform certain actions.
